inclusion.criterion: pregnant woman with P.falciparum parasitaemia at any density
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: history of fever; headache, vomiting, chills/rigors within 2 days prior to consultation
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: severe and complicated forms of malaria (as defined by WHO, 1996)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 17 year old boy with symptoms of vomiting, non-bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, chills and loss of appetite. He has laboratory results showing hemoglobin: 9.7 g/dL, platelet: 110,000 /cu.mm, creatinine: 3.6 mg/dL, BUN: 73 mg/dL, direct bilirubin: 2.4 mg/dL, and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH): 881 IU/L. Shiga-like toxin-producing E. coli (STEC) stx1/stx2 were found in stools.
